text.p: American Communications Services Inc said Tuesday it named David Piazza to be its chief financial officer.
Harry D'Andrea, the former American Communications CFO, stepped down in January to pursue other interests, a spokesman for the company said.
Piazza, a senior executive with MFS Communications Co Inc, a unit of WorldCom Inc, joins ACSI with 13 years of experience in the telecommunications industry, American Communications said.
Most recently, the company said, he was senior vice president and CFO at MFS Telecom Inc, a subsidiary of MFS Communications.

ACSI builds its own local fiber optic networks and offers special access, switched voice and data network solutions to business and government customers in mid-sized markets principally throughout the southern half of the U.S. ACSI today has 24 local networks operating and 12 under construction.
